items.title: FileNotFoundError after UnsupportedCompressionMethodError on specific files

labels.name: for extraction
labels.description: Issue on extraction, decompression or decryption

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
FileNotFoundError occured after UnsupportedCompressionMethodError on a few files

**To Reproduce**
1. run "py7zr x test.7z"
2. See error

On Centos:
```
[hongbo@wgz1 ~]$ py7zr x test.7z 
Exception in thread Thread-2:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/python3/lib/python3.8/threading.py", line 932, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/local/python3/lib/python3.8/threading.py", line 870, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 997, in extract_single
    crc32 = self.decompress(fp, f.folder, ofp, f.uncompressed, f.compressed, src_end)
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 1027, in decompress
    decompressor = folder.get_decompressor(compressed_size)
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/archiveinfo.py", line 390, in get_decompressor
    self.decompressor = SevenZipDecompressor(self.coders, packsize, self.unpacksizes, self.crc, self.password)
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/compressor.py", line 714, in __init__
    self.methods_map = [SupportedMethods.is_native_coder(coder) for coder in coders]  # type: List[bool]
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/compressor.py", line 714, in <listcomp>
    self.methods_map = [SupportedMethods.is_native_coder(coder) for coder in coders]  # type: List[bool]
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/compressor.py", line 968, in is_native_coder
    raise UnsupportedCompressionMethodError
py7zr.exceptions.UnsupportedCompressionMethodError
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/py7zr", line 11, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/__main__.py", line 25, in main
    return cli.Cli().run()
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/cli.py", line 91, in run
    return args.func(args)
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/cli.py", line 296, in run_extract
    a.extractall(callback=cb)
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 629, in extractall
    self._extract(path=path, return_dict=False, callback=callback)
  File "/home/hongbo/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 764, in _extract
    os.utime(str(outfilename), times=(creationtime, creationtime))
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
```
On Windows10:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\threading.py", line 932, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\threading.py", line 870, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\py7zr.py", line 997, in extract_single
    crc32 = self.decompress(fp, f.folder, ofp, f.uncompressed, f.compressed, src_end)
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\py7zr.py", line 1027, in decompress
    decompressor = folder.get_decompressor(compressed_size)
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\archiveinfo.py", line 390, in get_decompressor
    self.decompressor = SevenZipDecompressor(self.coders, packsize, self.unpacksizes, self.crc, self.password)
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\compressor.py", line 714, in __init__
    self.methods_map = [SupportedMethods.is_native_coder(coder) for coder in coders]  # type: List[bool]
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\compressor.py", line 714, in <listcomp>
    self.methods_map = [SupportedMethods.is_native_coder(coder) for coder in coders]  # type: List[bool]
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\compressor.py", line 968, in is_native_coder
    raise UnsupportedCompressionMethodError
py7zr.exceptions.UnsupportedCompressionMethodError
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\runpy.py", line 194, in _run_module_as_main
    return _run_code(code, main_globals, None,
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\runpy.py", line 87, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "D:\Program Files\Python38\Scripts\py7zr.exe\__main__.py", line 7, in <module>
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\__main__.py", line 25, in main
    return cli.Cli().run()
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\cli.py", line 91, in run
    return args.func(args)
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\cli.py", line 296, in run_extract
    a.extractall(callback=cb)
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\py7zr.py", line 629, in extractall
    self._extract(path=path, return_dict=False, callback=callback)
  File "d:\program files\python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\py7zr.py", line 764, in _extract
    os.utime(str(outfilename), times=(creationtime, creationtime))
FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] 系统找不到指定的文件。: 'a2002ToolBox\\PlugIn\\Core.dll'
```

**Expected behavior**
Only "py7zr.exceptions.UnsupportedCompressionMethodError" showed **without** "[Errno 2] No such file or directory" or "FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] 系统找不到指定的文件" 

For example, when running "py7zr x test2.7z", it only shows "Unsupported compression method is used in archive. ABORT". 
And when running extractall() on test2.7z, it only shows "py7zr.exceptions.UnsupportedCompressionMethodError"

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10/Centos7.8
 - Python 3.8
 - py7zr version: 0.9.4

[test.zip](https://github.com/miurahr/py7zr/files/5054504/test.zip)
[test2.zip](https://github.com/miurahr/py7zr/files/5054562/test2.zip)

items.title: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'encode'

labels.name: for extraction

items.body:
[test.zip](https://github.com/miurahr/py7zr/files/5050237/test.zip)
**How the bug occured**
executing "SevenZipFile" on a encrypted 7z file.

**To Reproduce**
run "py7zr.SevenZipFile("test.7z", mode='r')" then the error occurs:

 ```
File "F:\Forum Spider\core\decompress\decompress_utils.py", line 108, in un7z
    with py7zr.SevenZipFile(filepath, mode='r') as archive:
  File "D:\Program Files\Python38\lib\site-packages\py7zr\py7zr.py", line 345, in __init__
```

 - Python 3.8.5
 - py7zr version: 0.9.3

items.title: use max_length argument for raw LZMA1 data
items.body:
Lasse Collin said:

> If you use lzma_raw_decoder() for end-markerless LZMA1, make sure that
> you never give it more output space than the real uncompressed size. **In
> rare cases** this could result in extra output or an error since the
> decoder would try to decode more output using the input it has gotten
> so far. Overall I think the hack with lzma_alone_decoder() is a better
> way with the current API.

The [`LZMADecompressor.decompress(data, max_length=-1)`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/lzma.html#lzma.LZMADecompressor.decompress) function has a `max_length` parameter since Python 3.5.

It seems the `max_length` should be set to the output size when decomressing a raw LZMA1 data.

items.title: Unable to create valid 7z archive.

labels.name: for archiving
labels.description: Issue on archiving, compression or encryption

labels.name: for extraction
labels.description: Issue on extraction, decompression or decryption

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
using py7z I can create archives, but only py7r can read them - p7z (on Linux) and 7zfm on windows both complain the archive is invalid.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
(example)
1. Prepare test data:
````
mkdir t
echo 1 > t/a
echo 2 > t/b
````
2. Run following code:
````
import py7zr
with py7zr.SevenZipFile('test.7z','w') as archive:
    archive.writeall('t','t')
````
3. test.7z is produced
4. Check py7zr thinks it is ok:
````
> py7zr l  test.7z
total 3 files and directories in solid archive
   Date      Time    Attr         Size   Compressed  Name
------------------- ----- ------------ ------------  ------------------------
2020-07-12 23:57:05 D....            0            0  t
2020-07-12 23:57:02 ....A            1            5  t/a
2020-07-12 23:57:05 ....A            0               t/b
------------------- ----- ------------ ------------  ------------------------
````
4. run command in ternminal '7z t test.7z'
````
7z t test.7z 

7-Zip [64] 16.02 : Copyright (c) 1999-2016 Igor Pavlov : 2016-05-21
p7zip Version 16.02 (locale=en_GB.utf8,Utf16=on,HugeFiles=on,64 bits,8 CPUs Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-1620 v2 @ 3.70GHz (306E4),ASM,AES-NI)

Scanning the drive for archives:
1 file, 179 bytes (1 KiB)

Testing archive: test.7z

ERRORS:
Headers Error

--
Path = test.7z
Type = 7z
ERRORS:
Headers Error
Physical Size = 179
Headers Size = 174
Solid = -
Blocks = 0


No files to process


Archives with Errors: 1

Open Errors: 1

````

**Expected behavior**
Other 7z programs should be able to parse created zips.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Arch Linux
 - Python 2.8.3
 - py7zr version: 0.8.0

**Additional context**
I tried setting various filter combinations, but I have been unable to find one which works, I also tried not setting the base dir, but the problem was the same.
I also initially hit this with a less trivial set of files, but it seems to be the case for all filesets.

Support making archives with password.
Extend release schedule from Apr. 30 to Jun.30 and renumber.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When attempting to read a 7zip that has file name encryption turned on an unsupported encryption message is returned and it can't be read.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Ability to read the file the same way as with an encrypted 7zip file that has been created without the file name encryption option

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
7zip command line extraction is only alternative right now.

**Additional context**
N/A

items.title: testzip() method is documented but does not exist

milestone.title: v0.8: Encryption support
milestone.description:
Support making archives with password.
Extend release schedule from Apr. 30 to Jun.30 and renumber.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Documentation (https://py7zr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/py7zr.html#py7zr.SevenZipFile.testzip) says there is a `testzip()` method on `SevenZipFile` that returns the name of the first corrupt file or `None`.  There isn't.  There is a `test()` method that return `True` if the file is not corrupt or `False` if it is

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
(example)
1. Run following code with python3.
'
import py7zr
archive = py7zr.SevenZipFile('test.7z','w')
archive.testzip()
'
2. see error

**Expected behavior**
Either add the method (which I think would be a good idea as that is what the `zipfile` module does) or correct the docs.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu Linux 20.04
 - Python 3.8
 - py7zr version: 0.7.1

I would like to get the crc32 of a file without having to extract it.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Add `crc32` as a field on `FileInfo`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I suspect this is already in some deeper structure of py7zr, but I don't understand enough to find it.  I know it is listed when doing `7z l -slt file.7z`.

items.title: zstd compression/decompression support

labels.name: for archiving
labels.description: Issue on archiving, compression or encryption

labels.name: for extraction
labels.description: Issue on extraction, decompression or decryption

milestone.title: v0.7
milestone.description: Memory API, ZStandard compression, Improves on Windows

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
There is a project p7zip-zstd which extend 7zip to support zstandard compression algorithm. py7zr does not support it.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
support zstd algorithm

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Because zstd is non-standard algorithm for python, it is better to be an option / plugin to py7zr.
for example if user want to use zstd, then their requirements would be `py7zr[zstd]`

items.title: Add dereference option for SevenZipFile class constructor
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
py7zr does not have a way to dereference symbolic link as same as tarfile does

**Describe the solution you'd like**

If dereference is False, add symbolic to the archive. If it is True, add the content of the target files to the archive. This has no effect on systems that do not support symbolic links.

items.title: Archive links targeted to a path name recorded in archive

labels.name: for archiving
labels.description: Issue on archiving, compression or encryption

milestone.title: v0.7
milestone.description: Memory API, ZStandard compression, Improves on Windows

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When creating archive with symbolic link, py7zr record target file/directory as is with os.readlink() result. Tarfile standard module behave looking for target file in archive and normalize path as same as target recorded.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

- When creating file_info object in archive, it look for the target object in ArchiveFilesList and use f.filename of target object as a link target.
- Calculate relative path from symbolic links to target object and store it as a archived file name.
-
**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Implement a similar function _find_link_target() as standard tarfile module has.

items.title: Make the API more like core libraries

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The current API is not bad, although I do think there's some confusion when dealing with the list of file information objects the archive keeps internally. However, given Python already has a few libraries to deal with file compression/decompression/archival, such as `zipfile` and `tarfile`, and the fact that there are other 3rd party libraries that use a similar API as well, such as `rarfile`, pursuing something similar in this project might be something to consider.

Given the fact Python 2.x has been EOL'd, future versions of this library might just target Python 3, which will make things a lot easier when pursuing such change.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Adapting the API in order to make it more like `zipfile` and `tarfile`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
There are no current alternative solutions capable of handling 7z files in the way I want.

**Additional context**
[Python's zipfile library](https://docs.python.org/3/library/zipfile.html)
[Python's tarfile library](https://docs.python.org/3/library/tarfile.html)
[rarfile library](https://github.com/markokr/rarfile)

I'm pretty sure you are familiar with these, but I am not sure if not using a similar API was a deliberate choice or not.

milestone.title: v0.7
milestone.description: Memory API, ZStandard compression, Improves on Windows

items.body: If you create any 7z archive that has a path over 255 characters(8.3 naming convention). The program will fail to unpack them and give a "_lzma.LZMAError". If the archive contains some files that aren't in a ton of subdirectories to the point where the file falls into the 8.3 naming convention it will extract those fine it is just when it comes across a file with a 7zip file path of more than 255 characters.

items.title: Archive with links like symlinks stores links with absolute path

labels.name: for archiving
labels.description: Issue on archiving, compression or encryption

labels.name: needs more info
labels.description: Need more information or test data to reproduce

milestone.title: v0.7
milestone.description: Memory API, ZStandard compression, Improves on Windows

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
I don't is this bug or feature, but for archive with links like symlinks if file is not in same folder, then it stores links with absolute path.

**To Reproduce**
1. Prepare test data:
```
import os, pathlib

parent_path_drive = "X:/"
parent_path = os.path.join(parent_path_drive, "symb")

with open(os.path.join(parent_path, "Original1.txt"), "w") as f:
    f.write("real Original1.txt")

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel/path/link_to_Original1.txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "Original1.txt"), False)

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel/path/link_to_link_Original1.txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel/path/link_to_Original1.txt"), False)

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel/path/link_to_link_to_link_Original1.txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel/path/link_to_link_Original1.txt"), False)

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel/link_to_link_to_link_Original1.txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel/path/link_to_link_Original1.txt"), False)

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "a/rel64"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "rel"), True)


s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
with open(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.txt"), "w") as f:
    f.write("real Original2.txt")

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.[1.2.3].txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.txt"), False)

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.[1.2].txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.[1.2.3].txt"), False)

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.[1].txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib/Original2.[1.2].txt"), False)

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib64"))
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path, "lib"), True)


s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path_drive, "Original3.txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
with open(os.path.join(parent_path_drive, "Original3.txt"), "w") as f:
    f.write("real Original3.txt")

s = pathlib.Path(os.path.join(parent_path, "Original3.[1].txt"))
s.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
s.symlink_to(os.path.join(parent_path_drive, "Original3.txt"), False)
```
2. Run following code with python3.
```
import py7zr, os

os.chdir(parent_path)
archive = py7zr.SevenZipFile(os.path.join(parent_path_drive, "symb_2.7z"), 'w')
archive.writeall('', '')
archive.close()
```
3. symb_2.7z is produced
file in archive [symb_2_2.zip](https://github.com/miurahr/py7zr/files/4463967/symb_2_2.zip)

4. open archive in 7zip and view links which saved into body of files
for file "Original3.[1].txt" link is to "\\?\X:\Original3.txt"
for folder "a\rel64" link is to "\\?\X:\symb\rel"
and etc.

**Expected behavior**
1. There should be option to write files instead of links (I can't found)
2. If files are in archive there should be relative path to this files ["Original1.txt" in thise issue]
3. If original files are in external folder ["Original3.txt" in thise issue] then should write real files instead of links (another option).
4. Add such archive to test/data to test symlinks/hardlinks/junction with different file/folder locations

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [Windows 10]
 - Python 3.8.2 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Mar  5 2020, 17:29:01) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
 - py7zr version: [v0.6, commit #1e38828 on master]

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I need to get file from archive and work with it in memory. Now first I should extract file into temporary folder and then read extracted file. So there are two io: first write to disk, second read from disk uncompressed file.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Some way to extract file into io.BytesIO() without write/read temporary file to disk.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Or archive could be extracted into dict of io.BytesIO(), where keys are filepath and values are io.BytesIO()

**Additional context**
None

items.title: archiveinfo() UnsupportedCompressionMethodError with BCJ archive
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
py7zr throws UnsupportedCompressionMethodError when opening a file and retrieving .archiveinfo()

**To Reproduce**
Create a BCJ archive: `7z a -mf=BCJ test.7z test.txt` (create some test.txt before...)
Verify with 7z that it's BCJ - my archive was LZMA:12k BCJ.
Open file with 7zr and use archiveinfo().

``` Python
import py7zr
archive = py7zr.SevenZipFile('test.7z', 'r').archiveinfo()
```


Crash:
```
File "...\py7zr\compression.py", line 433, in get_methods_names
    methods_names.append(methods_name_map[coder['method']])
KeyError: b'\x03\x03\x01\x03'
```


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: W7x64
 - Python: 3.8.1 x64
 - py7zr version: https://github.com/miurahr/py7zr/tree/1a1c07fe83937478b48cbdb90fbb0d1ce8765ee0 (aka the newest master as of today)

items.title: Support "Split to Volumes" 7zip feature

labels.name: for archiving
labels.description: Issue on archiving, compression or encryption

items.body:
On 7zip, we can Split to Volumes the target file/folder we want to put in 7zip using `-v`  

Here the documentation Parameters -v{Size}[b | k | m | g] Specifies volume sizes in Bytes, Kilobytes (1 Kilobyte = 1024 bytes), Megabytes (1 Megabyte = 1024 Kilobytes) or Gigabytes (1 Gigabyte = 1024 Megabytes). If you specify only {Size}, 7-zip will treat it as bytes.  

It's possible to specify several values. Eg; 10k 15k 2m creates three volumes; 10KB, 15KB, and 2MB in size.

Thanks in advance

items.title: Inefficient buffer handling
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
This is non-feature, but performance issue.

https://github.com/miurahr/py7zr/blob/9a96bf706fa2891d84d6b28969915b2debbef401/py7zr/compression.py#L131-L151

Here is quite inefficient buffer handling, bytes connect, and slice access. It can lead a low performance of decryption of archive.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
SevenZipFile.close() closes file object opened but does not release header structure and files list.
It should also release header structure to prevent memory leakage.

**Related issue**
#77 

**Expected behavior**
Release all resources SevenZipFile has been taken.

items.title: The SevenZipFile class would benefit from a context manager
items.body:
I'd like to open like this:
```
with py7zr.SevenZipFile(fn, mode = 'r') as z:
  z.extractall(path = tempDir)
```

but I get an error `__enter__`, so I assume that the implementation of  `__enter__` and `__exit__` is missing.

items.title: ArchiveInfo.solid - Wrong result

labels.name: for extraction
labels.description: Issue on extraction, decompression or decryption

milestone.title: v0.6: Decryption support
milestone.description: Support for extracting 7zip archvies  with password.

items.body:
**Describe the bug**
`ArchiveInfo.solid` gives wrong result.

**To Reproduce**
I created an archive of 12 jpeg files, for a total of 32 MB with 7z 19.00, compression level: Fastest, Solid Block Size: 8 MB.  
I verified in 7z that the archive is indeed solid (Info button -> solid had a `+`).

```
import py7zr
sz = py7zr.SevenZipFile(path)
print(sz.archiveinfo().solid)
```

Returns False for those archives, despite them being solid.


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [W7x64]
 - Python [Python 3.8.1 x64]
 - py7zr version: [py7zr-0.5-py3-none-any from pip]

items.title: multiprocessing problem
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
py7zr uses concurrent.futures. When user application uses concurrent.futures, it become freeze or dead lock.

[Python document](https://docs.python.org/3/library/concurrent.futures.html) warns it.

**Related issue**
https://github.com/miurahr/aqtinstall/issues/86

**Expected behavior**
Allow user application to use concurrent.futures.

items.title: Relative output path cause producing broken symbolic link
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
In downstream issue report, 
https://github.com/miurahr/aqtinstall/issues/88

putting output path as relative directory, produced symbolic link is broken.

**Related issue**
N.A.

**To Reproduce**

Here is a test case and expected results
```
@pytest.mark.files
@pytest.mark.skipif(sys.platform.startswith("win"), reason="Normal user is not permitted to create symlinks.")
def test_extract_symlink_with_relative_target_path(tmp_path):
    archive = py7zr.SevenZipFile(open(os.path.join(testdata_path, 'symlink.7z'), 'rb'))
    os.chdir(tmp_path)
    os.makedirs(tmp_path.joinpath('target'))
    archive.extractall(path='target')
    assert os.readlink(tmp_path.joinpath('target/lib/libabc.so.1.2')) == 'libabc.so.1.2.3'
```

**Expected behavior**

above test failed with 
```
>       assert os.readlink(tmp_path.joinpath('target/lib/libabc.so.1.2')) == 'libabc.so.1.2.3'
E       AssertionError: assert 'target/lib/libabc.so.1.2.3' == 'libabc.so.1.2.3'
```


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux

**Test data(please attach in the report):**
  N.A.

**Additional context**
  N.A.

items.title: Supporting other compression methods (BZip2)

labels.name: for extraction
labels.description: Issue on extraction, decompression or decryption

milestone.title: v0.6: Decryption support
milestone.description: Support for extracting 7zip archvies  with password.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
7z has open architecture, so it can support any new compression methods: LZMA, LZMA2, PPMD, BCJ, BCJ2, BZip2. (source: https://www.7-zip.org/7z.html)

I have a file which was compressed with BZip2 compression method and has the following properties:
> Path = FILE_WITH_BZip2.7z
Type = 7z
Physical Size = 716637328
Headers Size = 146
Method = BZip2
Solid = -
Blocks = 1


I tried to decompress this file with the latest v0.6a1 release and I got the following error:
>   Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 17, in <module>
    print(archive.test())
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 688, in test
    return self._test_digests()
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 528, in _test_digests
    if self._test_unpack_digest():
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 520, in _test_unpack_digest
    self.worker.extract(self.fp)  # TODO: print progress
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/compression.py", line 277, in extract
    self.src_start + positions[i + 1])
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/compression.py", line 307, in extract_single
    self.decompress(fp, f.folder, fileish, f.uncompressed[-1], f.compressed, src_end)
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/compression.py", line 335, in decompress
    raise DecompressionError
py7zr.exceptions.DecompressionError


**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be great if py7zr package would support BZip2 compression method for file decompression.


**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I have tried to decompress this file in python with bz2 package but it failed. Im open to any other suggestion.

```
import bz2

filepath = '/home/amarkus/Downloads/FILE_WITH_BZip2.7z'
zipfile = bz2.BZ2File(filepath) # open the file
data = zipfile.read() # get the decompressed data
```

I got the following error:
> Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 5, in <module>
    data = zipfile.read() # get the decompressed data
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/bz2.py", line 178, in read
    return self._buffer.read(size)
  File "/home/amarkus/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/_compression.py", line 103, in read
    data = self._decompressor.decompress(rawblock, size)
OSError: Invalid data stream



**Additional context**
I dont have any

items.title: CLI: Passing password interactively
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
 When decryption and encryption, user need to pass a password to program. Command line option can be seen by another process, that is sometimes a problem for security.
 It is better to provide a way to pass password through interactive session, which is as same as p7zip does.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
When launch `py7zr -P <archive>` on terminal then process prompt `password?:`  and wait input.

items.title: provide method for extracting specific files from an archive

labels.name: for extraction
labels.description: Issue on extraction, decompression or decryption

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
For a serverless batch process, I have big 7z files floating around (2.5Gb+), which I  don't want to extract completely (30Gb+).
Otherwise the serverless aproach would be very expensive.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Instead I want to selectively extract files.
The argument of the method could be of a list of strings, which should match with the given file list of the archive and only extract the matches.
This would enable a leaner solution and focus on the files I am interested in.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
There are currently no alternatives, because I already tried to do it via the 7z binary provisioning via copying the binaries + libraries. :)
It happens, that there is a permission denied error - regardless of what I am doing.
The support also couldn't assist here.

items.title: Bug: wrong emptystream flag settings
items.body:
**Describe the bug**

When compressing dicectories which number is >8 or >16, py7zr produce wrong emptystream boolean field for that.

**Related issue**
#46 

**To Reproduce**
1. create test case which source directory has many(>8) directories and no files
2. compress using py7zr API
3. check emptystream field of header that should be all True but some is False

**Expected behavior**
emptystream field indicate all True

I'll push test case as unit test.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 112, in <module>
    archive.close()
  File "/home/fade/PycharmProjects/mbPatchCreator/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 764, in close
    self._write_archive()
  File "/home/fade/PycharmProjects/mbPatchCreator/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/py7zr.py", line 579, in _write_archive
    encoded=self.encoded_header_mode)
  File "/home/fade/PycharmProjects/mbPatchCreator/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/archiveinfo.py", line 977, in write
    self.files_info.write(file)
  File "/home/fade/PycharmProjects/mbPatchCreator/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/archiveinfo.py", line 854, in write
    self._write_times(file, Property.CREATION_TIME, 'creationtime')
  File "/home/fade/PycharmProjects/mbPatchCreator/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/py7zr/archiveinfo.py", line 775, in _write_times
    write_byte(fp, (num_defined * 8 + 2).to_bytes(1, byteorder='little'))
OverflowError: int too big to convert
```

The biggest file is a 7.7mb `.war` application. In sum the uncompressed files are 9.6mb.

items.title: Issue in close
items.body: it just self.fp.close() but it should call self._fp_close() that is thread safe and check reference counter.

items.title: v0.4.1 does not close opened archive file
AsyncIO friendly implementation

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

items.body:
Current py7zr is not thread safe and not asyncio friendly.
It prevent to use with multi-thread application and network application which uses aiohttp or asyncio.

It is great if py7zr become asyncio friendly.

lzma module in python core is not also thread-safe. so we may need some tricks to realize it.


```
        tmpdir = tempfile.mkdtemp()
>       archive.extractall(path=tmpdir)
tests\test_advanced.py:160:

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

>           os.utime(outfilename, times=(creationtime, creationtime))
E           FileNotFoundError: [WinError 2] The system cannot find the file specified: 'C:\\Users\\appveyor\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\1\\tmpi8fz4sea\\5.13.0/msvc2017_64/include/QtScript/qtscript-config.h'
```

items.title: Does it need internal queue(bringbuf)?
items.body:
From converge report, there are no record a code block that is run when we have data in queue(queue.len > 0).

It may indicate we don't need queue and a queue in lzma.decompressor is enough.

items.title: Refactoring `SevenZipFile._file_list_retrieve()` method
items.body: The method is now spaghetti code and should be refactored.

items.title: Test case github_14_multi is sometimes failed
items.body:
Some test is failed randomly.
This is because concurrent extraction cannot guarantee an order of extraction.

```

155    @pytest.mark.files
156    def test_github_14_multi():
157        """ multiple unnamed objects."""
158        archive = py7zr.SevenZipFile(open(os.path.join(testdata_path, 'github_14_multi.7z'), 'rb'))
159        assert archive.getnames() == ['github_14_multi', 'github_14_multi']
160        tmpdir = tempfile.mkdtemp()
161        archive.extractall(path=tmpdir)
162>       assert open(os.path.join(tmpdir, 'github_14_multi'), 'rb').read() == bytes('Hello GitHub issue #14 2/2.\n', 'ascii')
163E       AssertionError: assert b'Hello GitHu...ue #14 1/2.\n' == b'Hello GitHub...ue #14 2/2.\n'
164E         At index 23 diff: 49 != 50
165E         Full diff:
166E         - b'Hello GitHub issue #14 1/2.\n'
167E         ?                          ^
168E         + b'Hello GitHub issue #14 2/2.\n'
169E         ?                          ^
170
171tests\test_advanced.py:65: AssertionError
172
173
```

items.title: Feature: Show information about supported formats
items.body:
7z has an option 'i' to show information about supported formats.
It is better py7zr cli has an option 'i'

items.title: Feature: Test integrity of archive
items.body:
7z has an option 't' to test integrity of archive.
It is better to have a functionality in library and an option 'i' for 'py7zr' command line.

items.title: Race condition when concurrent extraction
items.body: When extracting concurrently multiple archive at once, some times extraction failed in py7zr.py:451  os.mkdir(target_dir) as FileExistsError.
